snippet: After a weekend in which more than two dozen people were shot, the department announced it was increasing its presence in certain neighborhoods.
abstract: New York Police Department announces that it is putting more officers in certain neighborhoods, mostly in Brooklyn and the Bronx, after weekend in which 26 people are shot and 7 killed; more uniformed officers will be assigned to housing developments and extra plainclothes officers will be sent to patrol during 'shooting-prone hours'.
lead_paragraph: After a weekend in which more than two dozen people were shot, the department announced it was increasing its presence in certain neighborhoods.

headline.seo: After Shootings, City Police Add Patrols
headline.main: After Shootings, City Police Add Patrols
headline.print_headline: After Shootings, City Police Add Patrols
